intro: Pteropepon, commonly known as the giant flame tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Bignoniaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, pale green bark and can grow into a tall, spreading tree. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a long, slender pod that splits open to release seeds when mature.
